conversation.text: Hello, are you ready to start?
evidence: Cut the squash in half and remove the seeds.

conversation.text: Oh yes. I'm very ready. How do I start?
You need to cut the squash in half in order to remove the seeds.
evidence: Cut the squash in half and remove the seeds.
Cut the squash in half and remove the seeds.

conversation.text: And how do I do that?
Use the serrated knife to cut the squash. Make sure the knife is sharp. And that you cut it in half lengthwise.
evidence: Use a sharp serrated knife to cut the delicata squash in half lengthwise.

conversation.text: Can I use anything other than a serrated knife?
Yes, you can. Do you have all the seeds removed?
evidence: You could also remove the seeds with a melon-baller

conversation.text: Yes I do. I'm ready to move on.
Okay. You need to microwave the squash. Get a microwave safe dish.
Okay, I have one.
In which position do you have the squash placed on the plate?
I have the halves cut side down.
Okay, perfect. Now you need to add some water into the dish.
evidence: Pour 1/4 cup (60 ml) of water into the dish and cover with a lid or microwave-safe plastic wrap.

conversation.text: I don't have any water on hand. What else can I use?
Okay. You can use vegetable broth instead of water. Add that into the dish.
evidence: You may also use vegetable broth instead of the water

conversation.text: Okay, I've decided to use vegetable broth. It will taste better. What now?
Make sure it's tightly covered with either a lid or plastic wrap, and then you can put it in the microwave.
evidence: cover with a lid or microwave-safe plastic wrap.

conversation.text: Okay, I've put the lid on and it's in the microwave. How long do I put it on for?
You can microwave it for 10 minutes. What is your microwave set to: low, medium, or high?
It is set to high.
Good. Hit the start button and then after ten minutes, take it out to check the texture. Is it tender?
evidence: If the squash is not tender, continue cooking in 1 minute intervals until it is.

conversation.text: No, it isn't. What do I do?
Put it back in for one more minute. It should be tender enough to pierce easily with a fork.
evidence: If the squash is not tender, continue cooking in 1 minute intervals until it is.

conversation.text: I put it in for another minute and it's still not done. What if it doesn't pierce easily?
Put it in for another minute, check it, and then another minute again if it's still not cooked. Once it is cooked, it will pierce easily.
evidence: continue cooking in 1 minute intervals until it is.

conversation.text: Okay, I've taken it out and it's now piercing easily.
How does it feel?
evidence: The delicata squash should be tender enough to pierce easily with a fork.

conversation.text: It feels tender and is piercing easily with my fork. How do I eat it?
First you have to wait for it to cool down.
How long does it cool for?
10 minutes, and then you will be ready to eat. Does it smell good?
It smells delicious. How is the best way to serve it to eat?
You can eat it with the skin on. Are you ready to eat?
evidence: serve the squash skin and all

conversation.text: Very much so. How do I cut it?
You can eat through the skin, or you can cut it into thinner slices.
evidence: Eat the squash by digging the flesh directly out of the skin or by cutting it into thinner slices

conversation.text: Perfect, I will cut it into thinner slices.
Congratulations! You have successfully completed this cooking task.
Thank you very much.

procedure.summary: Cut the squash in half and remove the seeds.
procedure.description: Use a sharp serrated knife to cut the delicata squash in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds and interior fibers with a metal spoon. A serrated knife will break the skin of the squash more easily and is safer to use than a smooth blade. You could also remove the seeds with a melon-baller.

procedure.summary: Place the squash in a large microwave-safe dish.

procedure.description: Pour 1/4 cup (60 ml) of water into the dish and cover with a lid or microwave-safe plastic wrap. You may also use vegetable broth instead of the water for an added boost of flavor. If desired, you can also add a dash of salt to the water for flavor. Make sure that the dish is tightly covered.
The delicata squash should be tender enough to pierce easily with a fork. If the squash is not tender, continue cooking in 1 minute intervals until it is.

procedure.summary: Allow the squash to cool slightly before serving.
procedure.description: Cool the squash for 10 minutes and serve the squash skin and all. Eat the squash by digging the flesh directly out of the skin or by cutting it into thinner slices after pulling it out of the microwave.
